metadata.title: CVE-2020-1983 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free vulnerability in ip_reass() in ip_input.c of libslirp4.2.0 and prior releases allows crafted packets to cause a denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1983` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm4').
